channel.title: Restarter.BAT
channel.description:
Hey,
I dont really need to use the RESTARTER.BAT however i will fix it just incase i need it one time. Wat happens? Well, after a while, (about 3 hours) when it goes to RESTART IT opens up a new RUN.BAT window (which means 2 is now running) and because 2 are running it crashes the server.
Heres the code? Any reason?
[code]echo This will restart your server every 30 mins :)
ECHO .... 30 mins remaining CALL :sleep 600 ECHO ... 20 mins remaining CALL :sleep 600 ECHO ..10 mins remaining CALL :sleep 600
ECHO .Restarting! taskkill /f /im java.exe start run.bat start restarter.bat exit ENDLOCAL GOTO :EOF
:sleep :: sleep for x number of seconds ping 127.0.0.1 -n 2 -w 600000 > NUL ping 127.0.0.1 -n %1 -w 600000 > NUL GOTO :EOF [/code]

item.title: Restarter.BAT
item.dc:creator: @MobilScape MobilScape
item.description:
@MobilScape wrote:

Hey,

I dont really need to use the RESTARTER.BAT however i will fix it just incase i need it one time. Wat happens? Well, after a while, (about 3 hours) when it goes to RESTART IT opens up a new RUN.BAT window (which means 2 is now running) and because 2 are running it crashes the server.

Heres the code? Any reason?

[code]echo This will restart your server every 30 mins

ECHO … 30 mins remaining
CALL :sleep 600
ECHO … 20 mins remaining
CALL :sleep 600
ECHO …10 mins remaining
CALL :sleep 600

ECHO .Restarting!
taskkill /f /im java.exe
start run.bat
start restarter.bat
exit
ENDLOCAL
GOTO :EOF

:sleep
:: sleep for x number of seconds
ping 127.0.0.1 -n 2 -w 600000 > NUL
ping 127.0.0.1 -n %1 -w 600000 > NUL
GOTO :EOF
[/code]

Read full topic
